alert.note: Alert for Montcalm (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 6:48PM EDT until June 29 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Michigan and west central Michigan, including the following counties, in central Michigan, Mecosta and Montcalm. In west central Michigan, Newaygo. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has already fallen, with another 1 to 1.5 inches of rain possible over the next few hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... White Cloud, Hesperia, Morley, Canadian Lakes, Stanwood, Woodville, Croton Heights, Wooster, Indian Lake, Amble and Altona. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
